Class ChessPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ChessPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener

    public class ChessPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener
    The ChessPanel, used to display the chess board and all the pieces. Also includes the necessary MouseInputListener. Note that in this file, multiple coordinate systems are used. Panel coordinates begin at the top left of the screen in (x, y) format whereas Board coordinates begin at the bottom left of the screen, also in (x, y) format. The methods convertPanelToBoard() and convertBoardToPanel() should be used to convert coordinates in one system to another. See the Board class documentation for more information. The ChessPanel is also responsible for launching dialog boxes for pawn promotion, checkmate and stalemate.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • drawBackground

        private void drawBackground(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw the background, i.e. the checkered squares. Chess pieces drawn on top of this work because the chess pieces should have transparent backgrounds.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to draw on.

      • drawPieces

        private void drawPieces(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw each piece onto a checkered square. Pieces should be transparent for this to work. This method must be called after drawBackground in order to avoid the pieces being hidden.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to draw on.

      • drawPieceOnBoard

        private void drawPieceOnBoard(java.awt.Graphics g,
                    Piece piece,
                    int x,
                    int y)
        Draw a single piece on the board, given its Board x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to draw on.
        piece - the Piece object to draw at the given coordinates.
        x - the x-coordinate to draw at, by Board coordinates.
        y - the y-coordinate to draw at, by Board coordinates.

      • drawChessRectangle

        private void drawChessRectangle(java.awt.Graphics g,
                      java.awt.Color color,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Draw a rectangle over a square in order to indicate it's moused over, selected or available.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to draw on
        color - the colour to draw
        x - the x-location to draw at
        y - the y-location to draw at

      • drawAllChessRectangles

        private void drawAllChessRectangles(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw all the chess selection and motion rectangles. A yellow rectangle indicates the square is being hovered over. A blue square indicates the piece currently selected. A green square indicates a square for the piece to move into.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to draw on.

      • stalemateDialog

        private void stalemateDialog(Board.StalemateException e)
        Dialog to indicate a stalemate has occurred. Similar to winnerDialog in its options and behaviour.
        Parameters:
        e - The StalemateException.

      • winnerDialog

        private void winnerDialog(Board.CheckmateException e)
        Dialog box for endgame. Asks the user whether they wish to restart a new game or to quit the game entirely. Resets or quits the program as necessary. Note that currently, closing this dialog box instead of selecting either option causes the program to quit with a -1 exit code. As well, System.exit() is used, since this class cannot "see" the JFrame.
        Parameters:
        e - the CheckmateException thrown at the end of the game.

      • resetBoard

        private void resetBoard()
        Reset the Board object to its initial conditions, and also reset the GraveyardPanel if it exists. Used following a Checkmate or a Stalemate and the user wants to restart the game.
